snippet: A major ivory trafficker who activists say has fueled the slaughter of more than 10,000 elephants was arrested in Togo, the environment minister said Wednesday.
abstract: Officials in Togo say major ivory trafficker Emile N’Bouke, who activists say has fueled slaughter of more than 10,000 elephants dating to 1970s, has been arrested; N'Bouke was found to have more than 1,500 pounds of ivory at his shop in capital Lome.
lead_paragraph: A major ivory trafficker who activists say has fueled the slaughter of more than 10,000 elephants was arrested in Togo, the environment minister said Wednesday.

headline.main: Togo: Major Ivory Trader Is Arrested
headline.print_headline: Togo: Major Ivory Trader Is Arrested
